function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Reliance on new data sources for measuring article impact","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Blurring the line between traditional and alternative metrics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited attention to article level metrics alms and their impact on scientific community.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate utilization of online comments, social media discussions, and recommendations as alms.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overreliance on traditional citation-based metrics for journal evaluation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inference of latent regions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Temporal dynamics of topics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Network information between linked documents","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Study of historical developments in a field may miss potential risks related to contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of topic modeling and data analysis methods may not account for public health and disease propagation considerations in the built environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Literature review does not cover all areas affected by the pandemic, leading to potential gaps in understanding contagious disease spread in different regions.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of green housing policies and guidelines in the context of pandemic-related risks.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited application of comprehensive data analysis methods for understanding disease spread and its impact on built environments.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of suitable environments for working from home leading to increased transmission of contagious diseases like covid-19.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate hygienic facilities and designs in homes leading to a higher risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of digital risk monitoring and health reporting leading to undetected spread of contagious diseases in construction and work sites.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty in work and leisure locations due to covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Focus on indoor environment quality and building materials","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rethinking of sustainability requirements for residential buildings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases due to prolonged lockdowns and close living conditions","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic policies on housing sector and green buildings","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ecological fallacy risk due to population-weighted assessments","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of personal data on individuals infected by sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertified research findings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlational findings instead of causal findings","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider other significant factors associated with infection rates","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to account for the impact of vaccination programs on the relationship between green spaces and infection rates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient control for socioeconomic, demographic, political, healthcare, testing, behavioral, and climate factors in previous studies may lead to unreliable findings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Stationarity assumption in relationships between environmental factors and health outcomes has been criticized, indicating potential variability in the impact of green spaces on infection rates.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited ecological studies fail to reveal the nuanced relationship between green spaces and health outcomes, hindering the effectiveness of environmental interventions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent sars-cov-2 testing among counties leading to underestimation of infection cases","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Substantial underestimation of infection cases in some areas during the early stage of the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reduced infection risk associated with forest within walking distance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased tree density associated with lower prevalence of early childhood asthma","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges with social distancing in highly urbanized counties due to shared green spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Weaker association between forest coverage and infection rate in rural counties due to private properties","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced nk cell numbers observed during the acute phase of sars-cov-2 infection.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Forest as a more mentally restorative green space than other green spaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Forest may be more effective in removing ambient pollutants than other green spaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"More people choosing natural forest parks over urban parks during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Tree canopies creating a more comfortable microclimate in forest areas.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reported boost in immune function from forest therapy and exposure to phytoncides.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ambient pollutants leading to increased infection risk from sars-cov-2","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to infection prevention measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weaker stimulus for outdoor activities in non-forest green spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Encouraging people to spend more time outdoors in green spaces may increase the risk of exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promoting physical activities in green spaces may lead to increased social interaction and close proximity, potentially facilitating the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enhanced social cohesion and cooperation in green spaces may result in larger gatherings and social events, increasing the potential for contagious disease transmission.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of outdoor opportunities for recreation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Suppression of social interaction","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"}]}
